flawed_nl_solution:
The mileage cost for the first apartment will be 31*20*0.58 = $<<31*20*0.58=359.6>>359.6
This makes the total monthly cost of the first apartment 359.6 + 800 + 260 = $<<359.6+800+260=1419.6>>1419.6
Similarly, the mileage cost for the second apartment will be 21*20*0.58 = $<<21*20*0.58=243.6>>243.6
Thus, the total monthly cost of the second apartment is 243.6 + 900 + 200 = <<243.6+900+200=1343.6>>1343.6
Therefore, the difference in total monthly costs is 1419.6 - 1343.6 = $<<1419.6-1343.6=75>>75
#### 75

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 76, not 75. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
